I've certainly experienced the benefits of [crystals in my health](https://www.theyoganomads.com/), but that's just my personal encounter. There are MANY fads out there when it comes to health products. So you may wonder, "Can a crystal really bring me good health?" If you're someone who likes to "trust the science," you may be disappointed to hear that there is currently no scientific evidence to back up the [healing powers of crystals](https://www.theyoganomads.com/crystals-for-pain/). In fact, many medical professionals and researchers believe that crystal healing is simply a cause of the "placebo effect." However, what is interesting is that new [research from Stanford](https://scopeblog.stanford.edu/2018/06/18/mind-this-research-reveals-the-power-of-the-mind/) supports the theory that our minds can help us heal and live long and healthy lives. For example, researchers found that people who believe doing physical work in a job counts as exercise live longer lives than their colleagues who do not see their job as exercise. In addition, researchers recorded an increase in study participants' blood pressure after telling them a drink they had just consumed contained caffeine when it didn't. Therefore, when it comes to crystal healing, it is likely a case of if you believe a gemstone can improve your health, it probably can. However, if you wear a crystal bracelet when you don't believe in its powers, you likely won't observe any healing progress, no matter how many days you wear it. So, if you have an open mind and use crystals with [intention](https://www.theyoganomads.com/what-are-intentions/) and trust, you may just experience miraculous results! Intrigued? Then let's explore the best crystals for health and healing.
